TopicTitle: Back to KSP after a long break

Articles.Content:
Hi!

I'm Barbouze, started KSP in 2012, played with it for a year and switched to other games but I kept looking here and there, knowing that KSP was steadily improved.

I recently installed version 1.04 and wow! Lot of changes and improvements, be it new parts or campaign. This is really impressive and I tip my hat to the devs for bringing me (and anyone interested in spacecrafts) this cool mix between serious simulation and fun arcade game!

I'm back from where I left, being able to do an Apollo 11 mission, launching satellites to map space bodies and assembling a space station

Cheers!

Hello Barbouze, and welcome to the forums!

Yeah, the game has changed a lot in the last while, and it's set to change even more. Version 1.0.5 is in experimentals and soon to be released. And version 1.1 is planned to come out before the end of the year.

Happy landings!

Have you noticed anything different about the game? There are some things changed. Not many, though.

Welcome back!

Welcome back!

I'm an old lurker from 2012 too, but I came back Jan 2015 in time for 1.0

The new changes are great, it's like many good mods are being streamlined and integrated into the core game, with such stuff as turbofan engines, comms range simulation and other stuff coming in 1.0.5.

Happy landings and ... AHOY!

Maybe soon we can make submarines and dive in Laythes oceans!
Welcome to the forums Barbouze, enjoy your stay!
